Review.Contenu: The 2nd tasker Mihal was great.  HOWEVER, it appears Taskrabbit willfully does not wish to be contacted via phone or website an AI product is used instead.  If this is correct, this is modeling poor customer service.  My 1st tasker cancelled at the last minute and there was no one to contact for reparations.  Why is it that a tasker can cancel at the last minute, but a customer cannot and will be charged?  How about answering that question?

Review.Titre: The task rabbit guy scammed me
Review.Contenu: The task rabbit guy scammed me. He told me I owed him an extra $50 to use his truck, and charged me additional money every flight of stairs he had to carry an item, and it wasn't even like he was doing it alone... I was helping carry the item, which also wasn't heavy. He didn't show these additional fees anywhere in the listing, so I was completely blindsided. Just felt very taken advantage of after the task was completed.

Review.Titre: Their communication sucks leaves you scared.
Review.Contenu: After having problems with my debit card ONLY with Taskrabbit I was told by their support they no longer take debit cards for security purposes. My bank so nothing even trying to come in. They say my card is fine and normal. Money to cover fees are there.I consider this insane and very disappointing. I have given them and IKEA many chances leading to even more frustration. I am dropping the issue at best effort and then some.I will not do business with IKEA and TaskRabbit (supposedly owned by IKEA) again.Have a nice day.

Review.Titre: The tasker took an entire hour just…
Review.Contenu: The tasker took an entire hour just unboxing and setting up stuff to put together a dresser. It’s unacceptable! She was OCD about placing every little screw in perfect position just as she organized the stuff out of the packaging. Unbelievable! Prepare to pay $60 for an hr of unboxing!

Tristan D cancelled our first appointment as he was in a far southern neighborhood. I agreed at  his suggestion to reschedule. He said  he was available all day. At the last minute he cancels again, and then Task Rabbit offere another more expensive tasker but he nor any other tasker was available (so much for the "same day" marketing ploy.Customer service had me on hold for over thirty minutes. What kind of clown operation is this?Don't have this problem with Thumbtack. Never going to use Task Rabbit again.

Task rabbit tool lacks "equipment needed" support to complete a job.My tasker showed up without a ladder needed to climb in the attic and I ended up paying for that hour. After calling customer support, they said its customer's fault that they failed to mention about ladder needed. How would a customer know beforehand if a ladder is needed or not for that job? Lost $100 and I deleted my account here. Never coming back and not recommending anyone to use it.

Review.Titre: Paid for Work that Wasn’t Done
Review.Contenu: Hired an electrician to repair or replace outlets.  He did not have knowledge to do it and instead screwed in a loose outlet casing.  Nonetheless I was charged the full fee.

My Tasker had a great personality, however, was not prepared for the job, which was to install five IKEA curtain rods and two photos which took him over 4 hours to do which is absolutely ridiculous. Then got charged over $350. Taskrabbit should have the task check in with photos on hourly projects to eliminate this issue as they’re being paid per hour very slow and inconsiderate. At one point he was literally standing on the ladder where my mom was handed him, his tools and the curtain rods for placement, unprofessional. The job was originally scheduled for one hour where they asked to start an hour before, and never left till after 4 PM where I then missed my appointment based on neglect of time and customer service.

Still haven't heard from claims... First time using Taskrabbit and after having two shelves mounted one ripped out of the wall within 30 minutes. More damage than I could ever believe. The second was pulling out so I had to take it down. Now I have to find a contractor to repair the wall... yet nothing from Taskrabbit...

There's decent aid on this site for almost any project you can conjure. The matter is the hidden fees are outrageous, and you don't find out how terrible it is until the job is already done. I'd have been better off hiring day laborers and paying the "flat rates" they quote. I'd rather had directly paid My worker the extra fees, than have it go to the site. I feel robbed.
Horrible horrible experience with Task Rabbit and their customer service. Feel scammed. Messages with support get no response. Waste of time and money.

The Tasker’s are unresponsive. The Tasker’s aren’t honest about the work they can perform. After having 3 different taskers to my home the light on my balcony still aren’t installed. I work in property management. I referred task rabbit to my clients. Not anymore.

Review.Titre: Tasker did not follow the instructions…
Review.Contenu: Tasker did not follow the instructions provided for assembly. A portion of our couch is permanently damaged. The entire thing needed to be disassembled and reassembled.

Review.Titre: The person could not do the job
Review.Contenu: The person could not do the job, left holes in the wall that I now have to pay someone to fix. He was specifically told by the handyman in the building exactly where to drill to hang curtain rods, and he ignored the advice, botched the job and was nasty and rude.

Review.Titre: This taskrabbit did not complete the job
Review.Contenu: The taskrabbit did not complete the job.  he didn’t know how to install the thermostat.  I sent him the make and model before he came and he said he was familiar with the thermostat and would be able to complete the job. I was frustrated because I waisted money.

Review.Titre: Been trying to book a task and it keeps being canceled
Review.Contenu: Been trying to book taskers for a last minute moving job. Have majority of my items ready to carry, have a van I rented from uhaul parking downstairs for 36 hrs now and even though the system shows me available taskers, the job somehow get cancelled. Cancellation takes place about 45-60 minutes after booking - which leaves fewer options for available taksers and so I’m pushed 1-2 hours later each time until there are no more taskers available . Service seem neat and useful but it is simply unreliable. I wouldn’t recommend it for urgent tasks and for last minute tasks. I’m now 2 days late in my moving with expenses on rented van I could easily avoid.

Review.Titre: My task rabbit was a CREEP
Review.Contenu: My task rabbit was a CREEP. Tried to get personal information from me. Was invasive, talked WAY too much. Literally interrogated me about who else lives in my home. Couldn’t wait to see him leave.

Review.Titre: The pull out bed is broken
Review.Contenu: The pull out bed is broken. It was not put together properly and subsequently broke the beam. It was clear that the individual putting it together had no idea how to do this and ruined our new couch

Review.Titre: I had a tasker come to my house to…
Review.Contenu: I had a tasker come to my house to repair the rollers on the bottom of my sliding door. When he arrived, he didn't fix anything- instead, he sprayed WD40 everywhere for 15 minutes and charged me $100. When I went to task rabbit support to dispute this charge, they only gave me a partial refund of $40. I could have gone to the store to pick up WD40 myself to do this work for $15, instead I'm out of pocket $60 and still have a broken sliding door. Absolute garbage company, CUSTOMER BEWARE!!!!!!

Review.Titre: Completely overpriced with no option to…
Review.Contenu: Completely overpriced with no option to select moving for inside the home. Spent $85 for someone to carry a desk up stairs because I’m unable. Incredibly limiting with types of tasks.

I am not at all satisfied with the company's service.  They do not have qualified personnel. I hired a service to install some IKEA furniture. The recommended duration was 5 hours, the person lasted 9 hours 30 minutes and did not know how to install them.  They charged me for the 9 and a half hour service and my furniture is still on the floor.  The company has not responded for the poor service provided.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THEM AT ALL

Review.Titre: Charged for a service not rendered
Review.Contenu: This was by far the worse experience.  After I contacted this company for assistance and texted on a regular to the Technician.  He arrived without the proper screws needed to fix my Eliptical and said he’s not able to completed the job and don’t want to mess up the machine and I would not be charged.  Approx 1 hour after the Technician left I received an email, my card was charged for an incomplete job and the invoice had been closed.  I am in the same boat as I was before calling this company.  I was all excited about doing business and had been telling everyone before service was supposedly rendered to me, now I have to retract it. Poor service.

I am sorry i am really disappointed with the service. The task person came spend 4h for a job of 3h, and he didn’t even finished the task. Now I call the customer service they keep telling someone will reach out even though I sent them pictures of the unfinished task

Review.Titre: Frustrated with high support and trust…
Review.Contenu: Frustrated with high support and trust fees. It is almost 30% of amount that I paid to tasker. I never expected high trust fees. I never use the task rabbit again in future. Good bye.

Review.Titre: All of the fees are not displayed
Review.Contenu: All of the fees are not displayed. Shows only the hourly rate with a 2 hour minimum but all of the taskers have a $60 or more extra charge for vehicles and gas!! That should be included in the initial booking and not after booking!

3 of the takers that I confirmed contacted me an hour prior to the appt. to change the appt. to a later time. Unacceptable!!!! I understand running a bit late, but delaying the appt by hours is a joke. The quality of these taskers is extremely poor. I will not use this service again.

Review.Titre: We will not use task rabbit again
Review.Contenu: We will not use task rabbit again. We did not understand that there is a 36% markup of the prices for each worker/service. In the future we will use other services or contact work people directly, Please know this very poor rating is not a reflection on the worker who served us. He was excellent,
I paid $70 for an hour for an item that cost $85 to buy. I was told it would be $30. He got there and told me it was a two hour minimum plus fees. Never again.

Problems with quality of work.  Paid for assembly of a dresser & partial assembly of a chest of drawers.  Chest of drawers is fine.  The dresser has 2 out of 6 drawers that won’t open as they should.  The top drawer on the left overhangs over the middle & bottom drawer.  Also, there’s a gap between the left bottom drawer and the bottom molding.  Tasker billed for an additional half hour as well.The resolution was to refund me 25.02.  Very dissatisfied & won’t use service again.

Your tasker damaged my property. Ruined a wall, broke my entertainment center, my curtains he mounted fell the next day and he said he was coming back to complete the task then never returned. He was dripping sweat all throughout my house and smelled strongly of tobacco. The worst experience I’ve ever had. Your claims process is very inconvenient and complicated on top of all of that and you shouldn’t be charging people when a tasker does not complete a task or damages property.

Review.Titre: The tasker was great, app is trash
Review.Contenu: The tasker was great. The app was annoying. Allowed me to do Apple Pay but kept having issues around my payment. I had to reach out three times for an error that wasn’t mine. Additionally I’ve tried to use Taskrabbit two previous times and the taskers cancelled moment of and I wasted my time.

I don't like the way Task Rabbit added almost $5 to the worker's hourly rate plus another $15 for your fees. I understand the fee for Task Rabbit, however, adding almost $5 to the worker's rate is borderline criminal fraud. You're saying that the worker charges $44.37 a hour, when he said his rate is $40 a hour. I TOTALLY UNDERSTAND YOUR FEE OF $15 FOR SAFETY, BUT RAISING THE WORKER'S FEE $4.37, WITHOUT HIS KNOWLEDGE COULD COSTS HIM JOBS. SINCE PEOPLE HAVE DIFFERENT RATES FOR THEIR EXPERIENCE.
Tasker completely ripped me off. Charged me an hour of time while he left my house to go buy a saw. Also the tasker was completely incompetent.

Review.Titre: Left us with more issues to fix instead of less....
Review.Contenu: We were really disappointed with our experience. We purchased closets through IKEA and were matched with a local task rabbit person to help install them. The estimated time for install was 15 hours however the installer only scheduled us for just under 5 hours. He left the empty boxes for everything all over our bedroom floor, trash on our bathroom floor, the closets weren't put together all the way (just some of the frames) and he didn't even put them in the correct places, even though I gave him the renderings and specific codes for each closet component. My husband came home and was really unhappy and said he just created a bigger mess to clean up than anything. I hired a task rabbit handyman to help take something off my husband's plate because of how busy he's been lately, but instead I just created a bigger issue. Really frustrating, disappointing experience.
This time Youssef called a half hour before arrivalto say he wasn't coming.

Review.Titre: The tasker overcharged me by 1.5 hours…
Review.Contenu: The tasker overcharged me by 1.5 hours for time worked. I messaged the tasker several times to question the charge and he never responded, then communication is blocked after 24 hours. My suggestion is that every charge should be confirmed by tasker and then person hiring before submitted as final. Also that communication should be allowed for 48-72 hours after work is completed.

Review.Titre: TaskRabbit does not vet their Taskers
Review.Contenu: TaskRabbit does not vet their Taskers, and when a task goes off track or fails in some way, you still have to pay the full amount for the task. TaskRabbit denies any responsibility for the Taskers they publish on their platform.

The tasker did not complete the job, as he did not have enough time. While he did a solid job, I would have appreciated if he said that he didn't think we would have been able to complete the task in time. I would have paid him for a few hours but still saved some money. I ultimately had to hire another vendor, which cost me more money in the long run.  This will likely be my last time using task rabbit.

Review.Titre: I am very unhappy and so sad I hired…
Review.Contenu: I am very unhappy and so sad I hired the man for assembly my IKEA closet that closet work just 2 or 3 hours he wants to get more money from me and he did very slow 7 hours and 30 minutes also he charged me $395Taskrabbit doesn’t care I contact the support no one answered me you should be return that extra money to me and never put some people something like that he just cheated me

TaskRabbit deleted my first review since I criticized them. I asked for dissembling a bed frame and drop off to Goodwill. I mentioned first the task is easy, less than 1 hour and the person needs a car. They sent me a bill for $34. After the job done, they sent another one for around $100 since the person needed to rent a van. This is very unprofessional and everything needs to be clear from the beginning.
Tasker told me he lied about his skills and he ruined my rentals wall. Left with holes on my wall and set up my dresser wrong. Need a full refund

Review.Titre: The tasker was very inexperienced and…
Review.Contenu: The tasker was very inexperienced and lacked the skills to complete the task. I booked another tasker initially and I was referred to this tasker by Task Rabbit after the original tasker was canceled. Be careful when they offer a replacement. I was busy and did not look thru the reviews.

Review.Titre: This task was never completed - BUT we were CHARGED!!!!!
Review.Contenu: This task was never completed!!!!! The worker was supposed to be at our house by 5 PM for a 6 hour job but agreed to come at 3. At 3 PM he let us know that he would come closer to 5 PM, which is fine since that was the original agreed upon time. At 5:30 we started calling him since we STILL had not heard from him since 3 PM. Around 5:37 PM he said that his phone had died and that he could still come to our house it would just be another 30 minutes. I agreed that was okay. At 7:05 PM he still wasn’t to my house (two hours after the scheduled time) I messaged him and he told me that he got pulled over for having expired tabs and no break lights. I let him know at that time we wanted to cancel his services. Just this week we got a bill for ONE hour of work, which was about $45. I would like this refunded as he did no work for us, and it was not our fault for the cancellation. We are very unhappy with task rabbit and don’t plan to use your services in the future

Review.Titre: I already sent lengthy information via …
Review.Contenu: I already sent lengthy information via  survey of what went wrong. In addition- after the Tasker left the job unannounced and unfinished- we found he had assembled the project wrong. Put doors where drawers should have been and jammed the mounting hardware backwards.  Really awful experience.

Instead of charging by the hour as indicated on your website, the guy I chose decided to charge by the project even after he told me that he would require a 2 hour minimum commitment. This was very misleading and unprofessional.

I was quoted a 2 hour job time, and a cost of $101 to put together a bed.  The job took 3.5 hours, and cost me almost $300.  I will never use your service again.  You have to be more honest in your estimates.
Horrible experience, handyman milked the clock on purpose, didn’t even finish the job after taking twice as long as expected.

Although the description of work experience and abilities made it sound as though the person could do what we needed, when he showed up he could not do anything and we spent $50 for someone to come say they couldn’t help us. We won’t be trying this service again.

Review.Titre: The idea and being the middle man is…
Review.Contenu: The idea and being the middle man is great good job BUT "trust and support" fee is absolutely RIDICULOUS! Try and be reasonable I stead of charging an arm and a leg
The person did not show.  I took off 4 hours at work.  He didn’t even response to either come or not.

I have tried every possible way to reach my taster post job to try and find out where my$35 level and mydrill bits are . I suspect he inadvertently took them BUT NO WAY TO REACH HIM  NO RESPONSE not by text, through this site nor from TASKRABBIT who I have asked 3 times to reach out to tanker

Too expensive. I paid $50.00 for a couch and ottoman and had it hauled five miles to my apartment. I was charged almost $200.00. Not worth it. I will never use this service again and will not recommend it to anyone else. Lesson learned

Review.Titre: How to Hire Someone w/out accountability
Review.Contenu: Our experience(s) with Taskrabbit were rather good pre-pandemic. Our first experience since was an utter fail.  Honestly, I’m happier putting it behind me.  I’m not going to relive it all here.  If you want details, you have my contact info.

Do not use this company.**ETA: Resolution was a credit for a service towards a new tasker - are you kidding?**This service is awful. The tasker was late and ended up spending more time here than necessary and STILL didn't do what they were supposed to do. I disputed invoicing and they STILL have yet to resolve because I couldn't provide pictures but they sure did charge my credit card for the full amount.  My husband and I spent 2 hours cleaning what the tasker didn't. Poor service - poor communication - poor customer service.

Review.Titre: The gentleman who came and put up my tv…
Review.Contenu: The gentleman who came and put up my tv he came late than charged me extra to do it after he finished instead of telling me before he started.

Individual I hired claimed to be great at moving furniture and appliances. Well he was no better than having your every day friend help you move. My refrigerator now has MULTIPLE dents in it because he obviously did NOT know how to move appliances. I was also quoted and signed for his fee at the end of the task for $230 but when the final charge came from TaskRabbit he submitted his fee as $275. Will definitely NOT use TaskRabbit again.

Review.Titre: Tasker sent someone else and he was a complete amateur
Review.Contenu: Tasker sent someone else. That someone else was a complete amateur. They overcharged me and refused to send me an invoice that shows the actual work performed. Contacted support but they basically didn't do anything to try and address my issues. They couldn't even get me a corrected invoice.

My tv was damaged and the tasker lied to customer care about assessing the tv for damages after moving it into my new home. The move also took a lot longer than needed because the mover did not bring his trailer and he stopped often to talk with my brother and boyfriend.

The Tasker Aryan arrived, worked on the light in the kitchen, it worked, left after 20 minutes. 2 hours later when my husband turned the switch the light didn't work again, we didn't touch the light on the ceiling, only the switch. I messaged Aryan on the chat feature of the App and he said it's probably the wire, then he said he will come back and fix it the next day, however my husband and I are both working, we couldn't meet him until Friday, Aryan said ok to coming back 1 pm Friday, without charging us again. On Friday, at 1:30pm when he wasn't at home, I called the customer service line, twice, total of 30 minutes and did not get a live representative. I went on the App chat with customer support and finally "chatted" with Ed who tried to reach out to Aryan, who is UNRESPONSIVE, so I asked for a refund instead, I was charge $234.48 for a 20 minute botched job. I was offered $117, for a credit towards another Tasker, and I asked who will that be and they said ARYAN. I said no way is that guy stepping back in my house, first of all he's a no show when he was supposed to "fix" his inadequate work. I will never use task rabbit again in my life. I did not accept this stupid credit, and I expect to get a full refund.

My tasker drove an hour in the rain with the back window of his van missing. My furniture was soaked and damaged. When I expressed my disappointment that he didn't cover the furniture with a tarp, he minimized my concerns and made excuses. I then reached out to Taskrabbit, for some kind of remedy. They did not agree to refund the $250 fee, and instead told me I had to go through a lengthy claims process.  I'm not sure how to find taskers on Taskrabbit who have basic common sense, and I don't think I will use the service again.

Review.Titre: Task rabbit is a terrible company to do…
Review.Contenu: Task rabbit is a terrible company to do business with because some of your taskers are total crooks a d frauds. I would not hire you for anything again after I was over billed for moving my furniture.
It’s a good app with reliable handymen but the Taskrabbit fees make it pointless to use unless you’re in a dire emergency.

The TaskRabbit Overhead Charge is Prohibitive. I don't understand how TaskRabbit incurred so much extra expense because I hired the guys for 5 hours rather than 2. Next time, I'll find help elsewhere. But I wish I could contact those guys - they were great!

Review.Titre: Tasker estimated the time to complete…
Review.Contenu: Tasker estimated the time to complete the job way off. Walked away with work just started. Spent time texting the next client while putting together the furniture. What an disappointment

Review.Titre: my phone number is incorrect in you…
Review.Contenu: my phone number is incorrect in you system, so there is no way that i can update my profile.

Review.Titre: The tasker broke our furniture and…
Review.Contenu: The tasker broke our furniture and asked for money via Zell. First, he asked that we pay him through his cell phone number but later changed that he receives it through email. Fred V. was double-paid one hundred dollars and has not refunded one of the payments, plus the service fee on TaskRabbit. We tried to contact him, but he is not responding to our messages. Taskrabbit is unsafe, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Review.Titre: Very bad quality of service and…
Review.Contenu: Very bad quality of service and overstated hours by the installer. I have writen dy other reviews that were deleted But i never had such a bad experience in my lifetime

Review.Titre: The fees make it not worth it
Review.Contenu: The fees make it not worth it. Also, the tasker can charge for as many hours of work as they want. This tasker charged for 7 hours of work for an empty, mostly clean, 750 square foot appartment. They did a good job but were slow just to run up the tab. I will not be using them or task rabbit again. I feel swindled.

They sent a person that arrived late and didnt really understand how to perform the required task which meant that HOURS were spent by the rep calling other tech support only to finally say he had to leave because he had ANOTHER job to go to. Thats completely unacceptable.

Review.Titre: The tasked assembled the dog house…
Review.Contenu: The tasked assembled the dog house inside of my home I could not get it through the door. I had to disassemble the dog house which defeated the purpose of me paying for this task. When I reached out to him about a solution to getting the dog house through my doors he just said turn it side ways.The tasked split the wood assembling my bed and didn’t even mentioned it to me when he assembled my table he just left the light strip on the table.

Mover left all of my belongings on the stairs and sidewalk outside my new apartment on a busy street on a cold evening! The door to my building was left propped open with boxes!  Left me high and dry!!
Can’t “unsubscribe “ from your annoying emails. When I need service I will find you so stop littering my email inbox!

Anthony came and it took the entire 5 hours to put together the bed with drawers. Ikea estimated he would put (2) nightstands together as well. Ikea sent the wrong bracelet so I went to the store to get the correct one and Anthony was scheduled to come the next day.  That day he sent a note that he wasn't coming. I contacted him 3 times and asked for him to reschedule and he completely ghosted me! He should of told me why he wasn't going to finish the job!

Review.Titre: Worked very slow and arrived very late
Review.Contenu: I saw a five star rating only for someone who I booked. Then it turned out she was unreliable came 1 and half hour late. Then she didn't even reply until after 1 hour when I reached out. Also she took 3 hours just to do my kitchen. Waa clean ok but not professional like I expected. I think she worked very slow on purpose. She didn't clean the oven properly.  She put things in place that became hazardous. I am a mother of four including a newborn so I wanted help to clean up throughly. She didn't even go into the bathroom or mop floors and she left garbage in house.

Terrible experience.  The gentlement we hired to move a table canceled at the last minute, and we were given a substitute.  The new guy had no tools and only a minivan.  The table arrived gouged, and the whole process ended up taking an entire day.  He said he would pick the table up at noon, and did not arrive until 12:47 - will not be using Task Rabbit again - ever.

Review.Titre: Too expensive and not clear in the…
Review.Contenu: Too expensive and not clear in the charges

Review.Titre: Very hard to communicate and charge…
Review.Contenu: Very hard to communicate and charge undisclosed fees.

I absolutely hate TaskRabbit. Their customer service is completely non-existent. Their policies on a customers balance are not posted. Their tipping policy is also unclear when you have a balance. Their ‘fee’ is extremely high. I will never use them again. I also would never recommend them to anyone. I have filed complaints with the BBB and Attorney General in my state. Avoid them at all costs.

Master didn't finish building the desk completely, there was a part left that didn't get fixed properly and charged more than time spent.Taskrabbit also charged an unannounced "Trust & Support" fee of $25.65, so what was expected as a $50 max spend of 1 hour of service, turned out into 1.5 hour charge and overall $95 bill.

Review.Titre: Last minute cancellation from TaskRabbit had me Scrabbling
Review.Contenu: The person I hired to move heavy items cancelled on me at 9 pm the evening before he was to show up. I had to go online and scramble to find someone else for the next day thru TaskRabbit. I ended up finding someone but paid twice the amount for the last minute booking. No accountability from TaskRabbit. Clearly not dependable and offered no help.

Review.Titre: Taskrabbit does not make good on improper work by their Taskers.
Review.Contenu: You have already been informed and I have received your extremely inadequate offer.  This company does not make good when one of their taskers improperly assembles Ikea furniture leaving it unsafe.  See my claim Taskrabbit.

Review.Titre: Job was incomplete and they refused to refund or remedy the situation
Review.Contenu: Scheduled to have a handyman come out to hang two window shades and a floating shelf; all of which fell down in exactly one month. Task rabbit refused to refund me as the service was clearly fault and inadequate, I will never use this service again. There’s no warranty or recourse for customers when the handymen they allow on the platform don’t perform accordingly. Not to mention that same handyman told me to reach out immediately if there was an issue, and then ghosted me. 0/10 don’t bother, just get a referral from a trusted friend or learn to do it yourself on YouTube.

Cleaners did a decent job however they were an hour late: In my initial conversation with the cleaners, they mentioned that it would take approximately 5 hours to complete cleaning for a 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath house. It only took 4 hours and somehow I was charged for 6 hours.  Customer service gave me a partial refund. I didn’t have to pay for hour 6 but was still charged the for hour 5 plus the trust and support fee for the hours 5 & 6. Never using this app again. Customer service sucks too

Review.Titre: Probably my last time using taskrabbit
Review.Contenu: the tasker left without fully finishing.  I then contacted them to come back. They finished in less than an hour and a half but billed me for two hours and forty-five min. They also charged me for hardware without telling me. (Way overcharged on top of that).  I did call customer service and they were able to help. But had I not seen the charge hit my credit card I wouldn't have known.

Review.Titre: Tasker did a really poor job assembling…
Review.Contenu: Tasker did a really poor job assembling desk. I'm nerve using this service again. I had to go disassemble half the desk to fix the mistake he made (I was wearing a armsling so I was more than furious to had to deal with this nonsense). I also had to realign the door to the cabinet and tighten the drawer. Worst part is, he took more than the predicted hour to finish and come up with that joke of a job.

Review.Titre: You guys left without installing two of…
Review.Contenu: You guys left without installing two of my items. Now I’m stuck with the things I bought just laying on the floor. Appreciate the service

Review.Titre: Not enough knowledge so took so long to…
Review.Contenu: Not enough knowledge so took so long to finish job.

Review.Titre: A costly, unpleasant experience. Makes no sense to use TaskRabbit for your business.
Review.Contenu: Potential savings with using TaskRabbit were quickly gone once we started committing to their platform. Their search filter does not work. You will have to comb through people who cannot do the job and waste time verifying this. To make this worse, you can only ask 1 person at a time. Booking system only goes 2 weeks out, so if you plan 1month+ out like we did, you have to remember to manually adjust the job date multiple times or risk being automatically charged. Our company was almost scammed by this. A top-rated tasker used this poor system to block our ability to schedule the correct date at the last minute. Their actions could be easily flagged in a better system, but TaskRabbit said nothing until I contacted them. Their "sorry" was an insulting 3.5% discount.In the end, using a different company would save us time, risk, money, and stress. Even without their highly reputed scammer and poor site functionality - savings are not worth the uncertainty and risks.

Review.Titre: Platform doesn’t accommodate “I can’t help with this”.  You still get charged
Review.Contenu: It was a waste of time for him and me because I my wires didn’t work.  For me it was also a waste of money.  Next time I call someone else it will again be a wash if I don’t have the right equipment.  It would be nice to FaceTime and he can ask a few questions.  He comes out and stays for five or 10 minutes and it was a waste.  Not his fault but the way it’s set up is not conducive to account for preparedness and needing follow up.  He was a nice man, nothing against the handyman.

Such a lousy experienceNeeded somebody to install a dishwasher (admittedly a more complex job than the standard procedure). Involved cutting a hole in some drywall. Picked a guy off TaskRabbit who was highly rated, with lots of reviews. Guy shows up. After about 15 minutes, it's clear he has no idea what he's doing, but rather than just admit he's in over his head, he stays for another 90 minutes screwing around (with me attempting to help him every step of the way), didn't manage to install the dishwasher at all, and still charged me $236. The faulty water cap he gave me to plug the end of the dishwasher line failed overnight and flooded both my kitchen and basement, warping the wood and laminate floors respectively.I called TaskRabbit support to complain. They said the first step for them is to contact the Tasker to get their side of the story. That was exactly the last thing I wanted, since that guy knows where I live, and I wanted him nowhere near me again. By some miracle, TaskRabbit decided to refund about half the total cost, but holy cow, that whole visit probably added $500 to the entire installation process.If I'd picked somebody who wasn't rated at all, then maybe I'd understand that I got a dud, but this guy was _very_ highly rated. How am I supposed to trust TaskRabbit if those are the sorts of people they send out.Never never never never again.

He didn’t actually diagnose or fix the faucet which was half of the purpose of the visit. He hung a mirror and toilet paper holder, which took the full hour and then charged me additional money for the anchors in the wall and a “new rate” for the work. I don’t think that was fair at all. I shouldn’t have had to pay that amount for the service.

Review.Titre: The tasker wanted to overcharge me for…
Review.Contenu: The tasker wanted to overcharge me for time he did not spend. I had to keep on refusing to pay. Your payment system is terrible -- kept on asking me to verify my credit card details. The chat system is so cumbersome, have to log in every time the task send a message, and to reply.

Review.Titre: It took over a month to get website…
Review.Contenu: It took over a month to get website updates implemented after it was approved.

Review.Titre: Service fees are absurd and not clearly…
Review.Contenu: Service fees are absurd and not clearly disclosed. I will not be using this service again and will not be recommending to anyone

Review.Titre: Used task rabbit a few times in the…
Review.Contenu: Used task rabbit a few times in the past and it was fine. Most recently, the app was so buggy it was almost impossible to use. It also kept rejecting my payment method - I tried 2 different cards (both valid) and it rejected both. I don't have any other payment method available, so that's a hard delete and goodbye to task rabbit.

Review.Titre: The tasker that came to my house told…
Review.Contenu: The tasker that came to my house told me to pay by Venmo or cash. I did and was then charged the same amount on my card. After complaining about it to customer service, I get blamed. I closed my account after being scammed on the first time using this shady platform.

Review.Titre: I’m less than a week new to Taskrabbit…
Review.Contenu: I’m less than a week new to Taskrabbit my first Tasker took a break and was late. I didn’t know that he wasn’t supposed to take a break and then the second task did not do the job correctly promised that he would come back and he did not come back and he disabled the chat and I have screenshots of the conversation so now I have to file a claim and I’m finding that, I’m still going to have to come out of my pocket again for a job that I paid for .
Charged additional 40% for various fees. It’s a lot of money, not going to use or recommend taskrabbit to anyone. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Tasker cancelled 1 hour into the task…
Review.Contenu: Tasker cancelled 1 hour into the task time before even showing up. I had to pick up an emergency tasker for 5x the price of the original. Could not find a customer support line to help.

Review.Titre: Non STOP spamming after first task
Review.Contenu: Non STOP spamming after first task. Unreal. deleted account.

Estimate was an hour and a half tasker worked 2 hours and got about 2/3 through. Then there were additional fees on top. Tasker took a while to understand closet system rather than being familiar. All in all it was twice my estimate and not completed because I told the Tasker he had gotten enough done. For a service owned by ikea and an estimate based on my ikea cart with fully designed closets I was disappointed

Review.Titre: My experience with Taskers in Task…
Review.Contenu: My experience with Taskers in Task Rabbit was between Horrible and Really bad.Hired 3 taskers to perform tasks, only 1 out of 3 showed up. At least one tasker had the courtesy to inform me he will not be coming in at least 24 hours prior. The other tasker did not even show up and did not inform that they will not come. The tasker who showed up was good and I have no complaints about him.
Too expensive. $60 trust and support fee?2 hour minimum for 30 minute job. Probably won’t use again.

Review.Titre: TASKRABBIT FEES ARE TOO HIGH, WON'T USE THEM AGAIN.
Review.Contenu: I didn't understand that the additional fees were per EACH hour that the Tasker was here. I had to come out of an additional $40+  dollars ON TOP of the hourly plus the $20 tip I gave him before he left. I won't use Taskrabbit again because although my Tasker was good, your fees are entirely too high. I did not budget for the additional money.

Review.Titre: It is very bad that the commission that…
Review.Contenu: It is very bad that the commission that taskrabbit charges is also applied to each hour, it is very expensive

Review.Titre: Task rabbits poor resolution to a fixable mistake.
Review.Contenu: Booking someone was smooth and easy and he arrived on time and was responsive and helpful. However after he left I realized the job wasn’t done as we decided it would be. There was no way for me reach out to him after and task rabbits resolution was a partial credit to rehire someone to fix it. Which will cost me more money (even with the credit) to fix the mistake. I’m totally disappointed in the resolution and was excited about this app but now I don’t have any confidence in booking people on task because of task rabbits policies.

Review.Titre: Bad interface & no access to providers
Review.Contenu: Bad interface, too many smoke-piped channeled inputs before you can ever see providers and rates. This also no way to schedule multiple dates and times all in one project. Another company that blocks off all channels of communication forcing you to go through their FAQs instead of direct help when you need it.

Review.Titre: Our tasker did not know how to do the…
Review.Contenu: Our tasker did not know how to do the job, showed up, wasted time for 4 hours, went to lunch and then quit! We were still charged for his time. Very disappointed!

Review.Titre: Made a wrong hole in my wall
Review.Contenu: Nice guy. However, made a wrong hole in my wall and acted as if it was no big deal. Suggested it would be fixed years later when they come back to patch up… But let’s be real, you aren’t coming back years later to fix and you probably just cost me $300+ to fix the error you made.

This is the third time I’ve used taskrabbit and the second time I have been really disappointed. The appliance installed had clearly not done this before and for some reason was not interested in following the installation manual. As a result, he missed a few important steps and may have damaged my brand new dishwasher.

Review.Titre: Way overcharged and not sure it will be made right
Review.Contenu: I hired a tasker to do a simple job. He was at the site 30 minutes and instead of charging us his minimum, he charged us for 5 hours. Blocked text when I asked for explanation. Elevated to TaskRabbit and they may be still working on it? But suffice it to say there are some dishonest people out there and as on any all digital platform you may have very little recourse.

Review.Titre: I do not appreciate being hit with an…
Review.Contenu: I do not appreciate being hit with an additional fee when I was ready to use your website. All fees should be clearly displayed at the front end of the process.

Review.Titre: Kind and determined but wouldn't recommend for more complex jobs
Review.Contenu: He was very kind, and had no issue putting in the extra time and effort to make sure the job was completed. However he was determined to a fault. I would recommend for simple jobs but I had a complicated kitchen faucet that needed to be replaced. I'll give him the credit he never gave up and really put in the work to get it done. However that was at the expense of destroying the old faucet and chipping my kitchen counter in the process. What I struggled with is that he was not equally horrified that he chipped the counter but said it would be covered up. I felt like I just wanted the whole experience to be over. I wish we could have pressed pause and said here's the situation, here's the risks, and made a decision. Everything is working fine and the chips are technically covered but it was a stressful experience for me and I hate there was damage to my new home.

Review.Titre: TaskRabbit does not have specific Taskers for fridges
Review.Contenu: This is NOT about the Tasker, who was great (I gave Nassim 5 stars), but about the system and your partnership with IKEA. I first attempted to hire Saif F. to assemble a fridge. He asked for a picture, so I sent him the IKEA link with a photo, measurements et specifications. Again, he asked for a picture, saying he was "not comfortable" w/o a picture. What (other) picture? Of the fridge totally wrapped? He answered my queries with ???, said that if I could chat, I could also text (no true, I don't have a cell phone). I believe he has never installed a fridge before. Tellingly, the IKEA site does not have an "Appliance tab" for kitchen installation. The second tasker, Brett, accepted the task, but after I gave him my address (Lower Haight, in SF), the chat was terminated. I had no phone number, no e-ddress. How can I contact a tasker back under these conditions, a one-way street?
Slow workers, extra fees that are not disclosed ahead of time. Won’t use the service again.

Review.Titre: I spent a full day messaging back and…
Review.Contenu: I spent a full day messaging back and forth with two taskrabbits for an admittedly small job. After multiple texts back and forth the first decided he couldn’t do it and the second said he would get back to me and never did. Far from the responsiveness I expected from their promotions.
The service is very expensive. I don’t think next time I will use taskrabbit. Getting someone local is way cheaper than hire a taskrabbit

The website isn't easy to navigate, I had to call 3 times for help.  I booked one installer and he never responded to my request.  I booked another installer and, she was running late, and I had to reach out to her for an update.   I finally booked an installer that showed up (I was told, when I called for help, I needed 2 installers), I had a big order.  I finally had a guy show up that was only available for 2 1/2 hours.  I indicated on the website it was a big job, 4 hours for 2 installers.  We ended up putting the rest of the furniture together, ourselves.

Review.Titre: Poor experience, bad communication, more expensive than expected.
Review.Contenu: Final cost was over $300 more than what we were originally quoted and the entire installation took a week longer than what we were told. We were told at one point that several items needed for the installation were “not included” in the kit that arrived and we were then forced to travel over 3 hours to pick up or purchase the replacement items only to come back and have the builder say he had misplaced it and just found them. Furthermore, he also invited a friend to the worksite without asking for permission and also made purchases that he deemed were “necessary” without communicating to us beforehand, resulting in us having to reimburse him for those items he bought without permission.
Not professional didn’t really know what he was doing! Took way too long for a small tasks and he didn’t clean up his mess just left!
All the extra charges. Ended up costing way more than it is worth. I’ll use Craigslist next time to find someone. You got my money but not my business.

Review.Titre: My tasker charged the incorrect time
Review.Contenu: My tasker charged the incorrect time, I corrected him via text chat. My invoice was never adjusted to reflect the correct time. I reached out a second time. The tasker did not respond. The dresser was put together to my satisfaction. However, the lines of communication was not great, and my invoice remains incorrect.  I will have to rate my experience as a 2.
1st tasker was a no-show.  On the morning of the task, we received an electric message from Taskrabbit that the tasker was no longer available.  bad form!

My task rabbit was NOT experienced in anything I asked him to do. He messed up my drywall and I ended up doing it myself. He also did not complete the second drywall task that I asked him to do. He also did not bring any of his tools. He asked me for whatever tools I had (screwdriver, etc) I don't like to get people in trouble because I know he probably needs the money but geez! This was my first experience with task rabbit and it was not positive. Although I did receive some of my money back, I should have received a full refund. He did nothing I asked for. It seems as if anyone can say they can do a task with no experience and become a TaskRabbit. I am Very disappointed.

The insanely high service fees, charged hourly on top of the taskers' rates, are robbery. They should be included on the rates shown for each tasker so customers know in advance what they're going to pay.I've had a bad experience with Taskrabbit two of the three times I've used it. When you say, "...our fee supports the safety of our community," you aren't really saying anything. Why is your fee different for every tasker? What are you paying for with that fee that is more costly to your customers when the tasker has a higher rate???

Review.Titre: The experience with the app and the…
Review.Contenu: The experience with the app and the Taskrabbit process was great.  My taskers were not great.  Came late reeked of pot improperly assembled furniture and damaged it.  Tasker was highly rated so ho figure

Review.Titre: My Tasker was unprofessional and made me uncomfortable
Review.Contenu: My experience with the Tasker I selected was negative. He agreed to a 2-3 time slot to put a bed and bed frame together and immediately upon his arrival said he would not be able to complete the job. This was because he overbooked himself and needed to leave early to make it to his next appointment. While he was working in my home he acted very unprofessional, cursing loudly while building the frame. I posted my experience when I reviewed him and he messaged me directly to rebuttal. He insisted that his inability to complete the work was a miscommunication on both our ends. He said I didn’t tell him the exact type of bed I had and for him it was a complicated build. He also said voicing “vocal frustrations” is common in handyman work. I replied and said I selected the correct type of furniture I needed assembled, a storage bed to be exact. He knew he was assembling a storage bed, if there are certain types of storage beds he struggles to assemble, then he should have reached out and asked for more detail when he accepted the job. Not show up and then communicate that it’s a hard build for him. I also said his language went beyond “vocal frustrations”, it was vulgar, loud, and continuous. Overall he completely half of the assembly, but I realized that Taskrabbit does not screen these people and you should be wary of who you invite in your home. I won’t be using Taskrabbit again due to this experience.

Loved the Tasker and how easy it was to locate him.  Hated the additional nearly $100 charged on top of the rate paid to the tasker.  The fee should have been made clear from the get-go and I probably wouldn’t have used Taskrabbit.

Review.Titre: I have had multiple Taskers cancel…
Review.Contenu: Last Tasker I had, said his wife would help out so he could get the cleaning done quicker and then expected me to pay double since his wife was helping.  I said no, your wife helping means you get the same pay as if it was just you. As you can do more jobs that same day.  He said 2 workers times the hours spent as if it was just him it would have taken longer to do.  Taskrabbit needs to se guidelines for this type of manipulation.

Review.Titre: It cost significantly more than I was…
Review.Contenu: It cost significantly more than I was quoted and I don't think my Tasker was as qualified in Ikea specific build outs as he claimed. It was supposed to take 1.5 hours tops and it took 3.5. I want to be reimbursed for the additional time that I had to pay.

Review.Titre: It took 3 hours to complete setup
Review.Contenu: It took 3 hours to complete setup. Everywhere I checked was showing me max 1.5 hours to setup so why I paid so much extra?Taskrabbit estimate was 1.5 hours. I checked many reviews of customers (non professional) buyers had it setup for themselves in 1.5 hours.I ended up overpaying.

I was assuming the tasker was doing the assembly properly, but there were a number of screws left over after he had left the job (and I'd paid w/ a tip) and I only found the pieces while getting ready to dispose of the cardboard box the car came in. Fortunately, my son in law said they were not necessary pieces, but I would have expected him to show me the pieces...not make me find them by chance.Then I asked him if he had the ability to take care of a towel bar and toilet paper holder that had come loose from the wall after recent papering; he looked at the situation, and I left him to it - then announced it was all done. I assumed the job had been done correctly, when, in fact, he did move the hardware over ONLY to leave the large gaping holes that I was asking him to fix!I contacted him immediately after and he asked if the holes were very visible! At that point I was done with him and Taskrabbit. Won't be using them again.

How could that go wrong?  Everything went wrong, they were late....the drilled extra holes in my wall.  The original person I hired brought another person to assist..he did not know what he was doing either.  The hanging storage shelf was not even level.  A TV mount and a hanging storage shelf too two people more than 3hrs to complete.  Not a good experience at all

Review.Titre: They did not finish the task
Review.Contenu: They did not finish the task. Wasted time and money on Task Rabbit  IKEA recommend a task rabbit to assemble their closet systems. He seemed to very knowledgeable about how  they are assembled. He knew the scope of the task prior but did not allot enough time to complete it. He left it 90% complete because he said he had another appointment.  I’d give him a B- on the part he completed. Per IKEA, task rabbit is supposed to align and secure the closets. I had to hire someone else to finish the job properly. Would not hire Task Rabbit again.
The movers were great! I don’t appreciate the extra fees now associated with this company and will look for private contractors

Tasker was great. Please tell me where the additional charges such as Trust and Support fee are written along with an explanation about “Reimbursement” fee of $50 Unless I hear I will NEVER use nor recommend TaskRabbit.

Review.Titre: this company does not make it easy to…
Review.Contenu: this company does not make it easy to connect with several tasters for the same job to choose amongst them. you have to schedule with a taster to speak to them and cannot schedule with multiple takers for the same job.

Review.Titre: That extra fee cost me like 60 dollars…
Review.Contenu: That extra fee cost me like 60 dollars unreal

Accidents happen. My tasker picked up a couch for me and delivered to my apartment. A window cracked when moving the couch (which I did not see). Filed a claim and taskrabbit denied it. Happiness pledge is garbage.

although the people on task rabbit are good and handy, task rabbit itself charges so much in fees, and they really avoid telling you about extra fees when you go to book. In a way the final bill is blind sights you.

Tasker was great slow but great. He finished the job that should’ve taken around 3 hrs in 6 but was at my home for over 6 hours… took forever to arrive & left at 2am … 3/10 & don’t recommend… probably will just put my own furniture together next time

Review.Titre: I wish Brad would have been honest…
Review.Contenu: I wish Brad would have been honest about his ability level.  I asked to have two holes drywalled closed, a wall built with drywall hung puttied and taped.  As he worked, I asked to make revisions. He agreed to do the work. After 3 visits, the work still wasn't completed - the framing was great - the drywall, not so much.  I've hired someone else to finish. Additionally, instead of asking about purchasing supplies, he would just go to the store and billed me at the end of the day. I never got a reciept. He would never announce his departure, I would just get a message thru this app.  I gave him 2 stars because he generally arrived on time, communicated thru the app and got the framing done. Advice: only agree to things you are truly skilled at.

Review.Titre: Disappointed in the service I received
Review.Contenu: My most recent experience is what is prompting my latest review. I hired a Tasker to mount 2 TVs for me. As a lot of Tasker's had "2 hours min" on their public profile, the tanker I chose did not. Once the task was done (I also have some complaints on my tasker's work) in a 1 hr time frame, I was charged for 2. The Tasker messaged me and told me he charged me the 2 hour min, I asked why as it was not noted anywhere in his profile and he told me "idk sorry for the confusion." I reached out to Taskrabbit support, the first person I talked to said she would look into my dispute and send me an email with an update. I never received one. I reached out to the support team again today for help. Angelo is who helped me. He offered to refund the hour I was charged, less the Taskrabbit fee they now charge on all tasks per hour. Even though I only had an hour service. I asked if there was anymore he could do since the charge error was in the tasker's error, not mine. I also asked when I should expect the refund on my account. He ended the chat without a response. Extremely rude, esp for a paying customer who is NOT at fault. Makes me want to reconsider using this app.

Review.Titre: The hourly rate charged from TaskRabbit…
Review.Contenu: The hourly rate charged from TaskRabbit which is not mentioned until after selecting your tasker is ridiculous. Also, one should be able to see the taskers schedule and all reviews before selecting them. My tasker himself was great though

Review.Titre: Unclear info leads to high unexpected costs
Review.Contenu: 1) 37% service fee ("trust and support") is far too high. 2) Depending on how Taskers list their rates, the final price may not be known until after the job is completed and the charge is put through. This is a price listing issue -- not an issue of a task taking longer than expected and additional time being charged. Given how much the price can vary, plus the service fee amount and how it is charged, clients might opt to use a different Tasker or service if the full information was known upfront.

Review.Titre: The easiness of booking was superb
Review.Contenu: The easiness of booking was superb; however, the trust fee being per hour is simply ludicrous. I somehow thought it was a one time fee but when I saw the total, I could not believe it. I also had to pay the parking, plus the guy had no clue how to install the rod, I had to tell him where to place the brackets. This error cost me an extra hour. It’s a convenient service but don’t think it will be my first choice moving forward 😢

The website is very misleading about their fees - it looked like the fee would be around $15 (flat) but, TaskRabbit wound up charging us an extra 36.5% of the total just for their own fee. We will not be using them again. Thankfully the tasker did an okay job; however, if we had understood all the fees upfront we would not have used them.
I had 3 blinds installed. Today one of the valances fell and cracked. I'm so disappointed in the services that were rendered.

Other than finding us a great handyman that did an excellent job on our sink, I would not recommend TaskRabbit. Their ridiculous fees were nearly 50% of the cost of the project!!!!! If we would have known this up front. We would have never used them. This "trust and support fee" is a complete scam. Save your money and use one of the other apps or hire someone directly. I would have rather given that money directly to the handyman instead of to this greedy company!Update:  I cannot find anywhere what the trust and support fee actually provides, it's impossible to find the answer. Please feel free (TaskRabbit) to post here publicly what this 40% extra per hour fee goes towards!
Mediocre. Task rabbit allowed their tasker to curse me out and be rude to me even with evidence of the behavior. I was promised a $25 promo for my next task — nothing was applied to my account.

Review.Titre: Taskrabbit's quote was half of the final cost
Review.Contenu: The person I hired did an excellent job.  However, Taskrabbit did not include its fees in the quote.  When I got the final bill, it was twice what I had been estimated, and the work was done in the estimated time.  The bad estimate is not the worker's fault; it's definitely the fault of Taskrabbit.  I will think hard before using it again due to the surprise fee structure.  It feels like the "resort fees" that hotels don't include in the estimate, but do when a client checks in.

The pricing strategy is off. Taskers are incentivized to work slowly due to hourly rate.*update after TaskRabbit's reply*I don't think the Tasker is at fault so not sure what there is to contact support about. The tasker took just a little more time than the 'average time' estimate for the IKEA items I asked to be assembled on TaskRabbit's website. Based on my personal experience assembling many IKEA items and observation of the tasker's progress, I was expecting a faster pace from someone who assembles IKEA furniture every day. I would prefer a pricing model that bills per item completed and is more upfront about the final cost. The current business models incentivizes the Taskers to 'fill up the time' that is estimated and have no reason to work faster.

Review.Titre: Talk directly to insure clear communications
Review.Contenu: It is probably better to speak directly.   I didn’t get what I needed probably due to lack of clear communication.

There were definitely fees from Task Rabbit that I was unaware of. I had the impression that those fees were included in the quoted rate for work. Additionally, who is the quantity control person. I was quoted 6 hours of work and he was here 9.5 hours. If the request or underestimated the time frame, then there should still be a conversation before continuing to work. Or who monitors that the hired contractor is working efficiently?

Review.Titre: the price of corparate task rabbit is too high!
Review.Contenu: the tasker i hired is great! she's perfect for the office admin task i hired her for.and while i loved using task rabbit years ago, the newer corporate version of task rabbit since the purchase by ikea will mean that i am unlikely to work with them again due to the imposition of a 25-30% upcharge. frankly it is insane and not sustainable. if this upcharge were to lessen with each repeat use of the same tasker, that would be great, down to 5-10% for repeat scheduling of the tasker. alas they don't. it just feels like greed personified. and that i am not interested in.

The fees they charge are simply outrageous. On top of the hourly rate for the tasker, TaskRabbit tacks on an additional service fee of up to 41%.  I hired someone at $20/hour and ended up paying $28.20 per hour after TaskRabbit's fees. That's highway robbery!I won't be using TaskRabbit anymore with fees this high. I don't mind paying fair prices, but 41% on top of hourly rates is absurd. They are taking gross advantage of customers in my opinion. I know Taskers deserve to be paid for their time, but TaskRabbit is lining their own pockets with crazy fees too. I can't recommend using this app until they lower their fees to a reasonable level.

Review.Titre: The Task Rabbit was 2 hours later than…
Review.Contenu: The Task Rabbit was 2 hours later than the appointment time and failed to complete the task correctly. He did not secure the middle bracket of the curtain rod, leaving the fabric to sag and inadequately covering the window in the bedroom. DISAPPOINTED! On top of that, he spent merely 20 minutes on the task and charged two hours worth of service!!!!!!

Review.Titre: I think Taskrabbit taxes way to many…
Review.Contenu: I think Taskrabbit taxes way to many fees the app should be more transparent on total cost for the time you need for your task sort of how air bnb finally start doing that can make customers not come back after a task is complete like myself I don’t know if I’ll use again will try the competition

From the very beginning I explained I needed to know if list of To Dos would be completed before 11:30am, welp that didn’t happen took 2 more hours than planned…not sure if that’s intentional or not however not only did the list not get completed but it took twice as long for MORE MONEY…Alsooooo I have a ton of EXTRA screws and such left over from the assembly…Doubtful I would use this service again

Booked tasker several times who canceled out on us on multiple occasions. Finally one who helped us with the task needed lot of help from us and we had to hire another person to help her to finish the job! Costed us double the amount suggested by the Taskrabit!

This review is about the TaskRabbit service, not the Tasker who did my job - he did a good job. I find TaskRabbit's process frustrating. As a customer, the very first step is for me to put myself at the mercy of before interacting with him: I have to choose somebody based only on his reviews; I have to pick a specific day, time, and my personal estimate of how long the job will take; I have to describe what I need. Then it is up to the tasker to decide whether to take the job or not. He can take the job without ever responding to a single question I may have asked. Once the job is less than 24 hours away, I have to pay for it even if I cancel - and even if that is before I've been able to determine if the Tasker really is a good fit for the job. Twice, I have had the tasker send me one message asking for "more detail," and then I didn't hear from him again until the cancellation window was about to close. The first time I cancelled. The second time I decided to take my chances, and ultimately the Tasker did a good job. However I was stressed the whole time because I had not had an adequate conversation with him until a few hours before the appointment, and I had already put my tenants through the inconvenience of scheduling their lives around the appointment.

Used for a cleaning service. The person was incredibly nice and on time. Cleaning job took an hour longer than same site by other cleaning crews but was less thorough. The main cause of frustration though is the TR fee which ended but being $70+ on a $180 job, so essentially a 40% add-on. And you're expected to tip. Never again, thanks!

Review.Titre: I chose a taster who took on the job…
Review.Contenu: I chose a taster who took on the job but said he’ll be a few minutes late, than an hour late than another hour and after the third hour had passed as I’m waiting for him in an empty apartment with nothing to do, he canceled. He then got out of the chat leaving me with no recourse. Task rabbit should ask me what happened when a job is canceled and allow me to leave a review for the tasker. This guy walks around with only five star reviews. That’s on you guys!

I felt like the responsiveness of the person I hired was quite slow, and when we finally nailed down a time, it was changed from the initial request and then they were late. In addition, the trust and service fee was 25% of my final charges which felt really steep, I wasn't expecting that. Though the final product was good, the process just wasn't. I won't be using this service again.

Paid $341 and expecting something more professional. This task is for an empty house. In given detail states clearly that need to wipe windows and cabinets bathrooms as well. Improper equipments. Lot of unwipe surfaces left behind. We need to wipe all inside cabinets in kitchen again. Didn’t clean windows which we didn’t know that we need to inform. Curtain holder didn’t been touch. I chose because the good review taskers was unavailable and wanna give a try. There was a misunderstanding about charge. I asked how much it cost for 2 persons. The response was “it is the same” which actually meant will be charged same rate = double. They was nice guys but for job, not recommended.

Review.Titre: When you get payed by the hour….
Review.Contenu: Well, Donald was a very nice man or he would get a one star.  The estimated time to build these pieces was 2 hours so I allotted twice that when deciding to use this service just to be safe.  It took Donald 12.5 hours.  I went down to ask him if he needed help multiple times, only to find he had started building something and hanging it in a different way than we had clearly described, or had made arbitrary decisions without us and had to redo multiple steps.  We had to cancel our family dinner plans because he was here until 830pm.  I’ve built many IKEA items and it looks like I’ll be building more in the future.

Clay repeatedly delayed my scheduled appointment. This conflicted with my schedule for two days. He ended up not showing up at all on Friday, was two hours late on Saturday and my television has to be replaced!
The tasker was late and left a mess behind.

the fees are really high , the handyman came and said minimum is 2hrs , when they didnt put that way on the website, ( some of them did).  Also i had to pay the amount right away even though i needed the part to be ordered and then the handyman said he will come back to repair, so that is not a flow that is done well in the system

The person who came for assembling the stuffs was so slow and assembling a bed and just half a sofa took 5 hours.If he was proficient enough, it should took 2 hours at most and I had not to pay extra 150 USD for his slowness.
Unfortunately, the doors were put on upside down … need I say more.

Very UN user friendly.  Back and forth and 'round in circles. Email text phone app I gave up  then you sent someone out thinking they were doing another task than I eventually needed. Helpful and kind I found other tasks to fill the time. I will not use task rabbit again.PLEASE CANCEL ANY UPCOMING TASKS ASSIGNED TO HIM OR ANYONE ELSE.

So far, unimpressed.  The TR website is clumsy and, for me, unnavigable.  If something is unclear, there is no live person who can help me; I just get sent back to the website.  I did finally manage to get an appointment for yesterday, 9/27/2023.  Meanwhile I had other things I wished to add to the list but was unable to do so on the website.  When Paul arrived I showed him what else I needed done.  He said that since he was heavily booked for that day, he would get the necessary parts and I could then make another appointment.  This was fine, and he advised me that there might be a nominal charge for his having come and assessed the job.  I then received a bill for the full hour, to which I replied that the job had been cancelled.  I have not heard back one way or the other.

Review.Titre: First Tasker (Mehdi) canceled me on the…
Review.Contenu: First Tasker (Mehdi) canceled me on the morning of scheduled job after confirming and rescheduling more that 3x without any explanation or notice.  He had expected to add 1 more tasker to help, which he should have told me he was not experienced enough to do the job.  He should not be described as “elite tasker”on his profile.Second tasker (Nageb) came on time and was efficient with completing job.  He charged 1.5 hours more so the total cost was $500+ for assembling an Ikea Pax, which is kind of pricey considering it is 42% of the cost of the Pax system.  But the main complaint was that the handles on the doors were installed crooked and misaligned.  He only eyeballed it and hurried to leave.  I only discovered this after he left and he ghosted me afterwards when I asked if he could fix it.

BE TRANSPARENT. Put ALL IN pricing UP FRONT. When someone is shopping for a service within a budget it is not helpful and takes much more time than needed to search through taskers you THINK are within your budget only to find that taskrabbit adds all their fees at the end.

Review.Titre: Tasker is fine- the app could use…
Review.Contenu: Tasker is fine- the app could use improvement.My taskrabbit was great- unfortunately, I was not able to apply the credit previously offered by Taskrabbit for the last service I'd used that did not go well. I chatted with the bot and submitted my concern for review and a week later, nothing was done about it and no one has followed up.

Hired someone, Matt, for a moving job. They cancelled at 8:15 pm the night before the 11:00am move the next day!  I had to scramble to find someone else and had to pay $22 an hour more than the original guy. Task Rabbit penalizes people who book someone and then cancel but they have no consequences for Taskers who cancel or don’t show up.

Incomplete,unstable,missingnails. Notices after the tasker left that the mount is not aligned correctly in the floating desk and nails were missing that would make it fully secure. Table unstable in use.

I’m thankful for the help in putting my furniture together; however, I felt like it took WAY too long to get the job done. I was not expecting nor did I plan for her to be at my house for 5.5 hours. I estimated it to be a 2-3 hour job, which it was accepted at, and what I expected it to be done in. It just felt like she took an excessively long amount of time. Additionally, I didn’t like some of the conversations I overheard with my older daughter where she was talking about the patriarchy and then made a blanket assumption that I didn’t work. At that point I was just too tired to say anything and knew she was finishing up, so she could head out of my house.
Needs higher skilled people - more quality assurance checks. My "moving help" task resulted in a damaged, very expensive dresser. I would use Lugg next time.

Review.Titre: I was charged $110 by TR on the top of…
Review.Contenu: I was charged $110 by TR on the top of payment to the movers. Movers were great and professional but I am surprised by 30% surcharge by TR. this was not communicated with me before hand and appears largely disproportionate.

My experience was unfulfilling. My tasker did not complete the task. He gave every excuse and no solution. He was too talkative prior to arriving and still was too talkative while here when he arrived 15 mins late.

The Tasker was excellent, and did a great job.  This review is not about that individual.  The outrageous fee imposed by Taskrabbit per HOUR of the job increased the project cost by an unexpected, unnecessary amount. Probably will not use the service again.

Review.Titre: The cabinet doors were installed too…
Review.Contenu: The cabinet doors were installed too high causing an open gap on the bottom

The taskers were constantly late or trying to reschedule. The Messages I sent to taskers to coordinate another meeting time, showed up as sent. Then when I would go back into the app to check a response, my message would be gone like it had never been sent. Sometimes the message would appear as orange, but there was no indication key or error message associated with what that meant. This happened multiple times and I ended up just having to cancel with the taskers because it became to hard to communicate a time to reschedule.

Review.Titre: Plumber we hired did great job.…Then
Review.Contenu: The plumber that we hired did a great job in October 2022 when we first moved in putting in a restaurant style faucet in the kitchen so we hired them to change the filters in our reverse osmosis, filtered water tank The job was left partially done & follow-up was disappointing // We were hoping to hone in on him for all of our long term plumbing needs…..

We used TaskRabbit (owned by IKEA) for a small light carpentry task. An old microwave needed to be removed from a wooden cupboard and replaced with our new microwave.The carpenter was excellent and did the job in less than an hour. However he had a 2-hour minimum, and I thought that it would take at least that long. So he kindly refused a tip. My complaint is that TaskRabbit has very poor disclosure of how much their fees will be added until you get the invoice. My payment to the carpenter was $134.20 and TaskRabbit added $49.41 (36.8%) to the bill for a “Trust & Support Fee” which I feel is far too high.

Review.Titre: I hired my first tasker to mount a…
Review.Contenu: I hired my first tasker to mount a TV, install new blinds and mount a couple small shelves. Blinds look great, TV mount was installed in a creative way, and one of the shelves fell down after they left. I noticed multiple holes in my wall that they did not tell me about. Now I’m worried about how the TV was mounted. I relied on reviews to pick my tasker, but if I ever choose to do this again I will ask for more examples of work and maybe even a second opinion. I hired through here because I am not an expert nor do I have the time and tools to hang stuff. Was hoping for a better experience.

Review.Titre: Bad experience…3 taskers cancelled the appointment before one showed up.
Review.Contenu: We booked a tasker that agreed to a weekend time, the delivery of furniture was delayed and he agreed to move the appointment time and then simply cancelled after he was supposed to be there. Then we tried to book two more taskers to assemble furniture and they both canceled after accepting the job. Taskers book various jobs at a time and don’t show up and I see that there are no consequences.  Just an unhappy customer left hanging with unassembled furniture. I am sure that if I cancelled last minute or after appointment I would be charged for taskers time. I was then able to get someone to help the next day “Rafig”, and this tasker was very helpful and communicated well over the app. Task Rabbit takes my credit card and I don’t get any notification if I was charged for the cancelled appointments. Would not use the platform again.

Review.Titre: I should be able to select multiple…
Review.Contenu: I should be able to select multiple taskers for a job.. it’s difficult to select only one and chat with the person. If that person doesn’t fit your job description then again you have to start new search and add all the details again

The guy wasn’t very nice! He refused to take down the boxes to the garbage dumpster. I had recently had surgery & wasn’t allowed to do any physical labor. I also asked if I could pay him extra to hang a few pictures & he said no - he’s furniture assembly only.

Difficult to use the app - suddenly it tells me my chat has been disabled - no idea why or how to get it back . Really liked my first tasker and she said she’d cone again  but now can’t contact her. This is my first experience and doesn’t make me want to use again .

Review.Titre: Okay but, will not use again....
Review.Contenu: The hiring process is great, quick, and efficient.  However, the $50+ dollar service charge on top of an additional per hour charge seems like a rip off.

My tasker was not on time, I had to call him to see if he was even coming.  Also, when he did arrive, he didn't bring all of the parts, even though I sent him pictures of the damaged parts.  Also, he didn't even apologize, say he was sorry, or anything about his lateness.  Lastly, after half doing the job, he tried to finagle me on the price and to top it off, my sink still isn't fixed correctly!!  Won't use them again!!

I wish I was aware of the fees before I agreed to the service. There is no way to track when the tasker is finished with the work unless you’re there. It was my first time and I didn’t know what to expect. The tasker wasn’t communicating at all. He didn’t let me know he was finished until I asked him about the task then 2 minutes later he stopped the charges which charged me 5 hours just for a cleaning on my apartment that I already had cleaned.

Review.Titre: Maybe good for very easy tasks
Review.Contenu: I have attempted to use Task Rabbit for three tasks and I have never successfully had a task completed.In each case, the Tasker came, tried, but was unable to complete the job.None of the jobs was particularly involved or complicated.

Review.Titre: Tasker was great, but outrageous hidden fees.
Review.Contenu: The actual tasker was great, but the hourly "Trust and Support fee" on top of the task's rate is a joke.  An expensive joke.  Nowhere is this clearly disclosed.   Not when you sign up for the task, and in the confirmation email it is only in tiny, grayed out print.
